briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of a Nasal Spray to Treat Seasonal Allergies
officialTitle: Randomized, Double-Blind Trial of MP29-02 Nasal Spray Compared to Placebo, Astelin Nasal Spray, and Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray in the Treatment of Patients With Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if two allergy medications (azelastine and fluticasone) are more effective than placebo or either medication alone (azelastine or fluticasone)

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12 Hour Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS)

effectByArm.arm: Azelastine HCl 548 Mcg / Fluticasone Propionate 200 Mcg
